creditline: Gift of Mary and Bob Mersky
description: hyper-realistic black-and-white image of folded or creased and crumpled paper and/or cloth; shaded ground space at right
provenance: The artist; (Miles McEnery Gallery, New York, sold to Mersky, 2018); Robert B, Mersky, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
text: In this graphite still life drawing of a crumbled sheets of paper, Rosana Castrillo Diaz reveals a mastery of careful and deliberate observation, belying the apparent simplicity of the work. Her choice of subject is deliberate, reflecting her interest in the ordinary objects of daily life. As she explained of this drawing, “In this body of work, there is a direct connection between memory, emotions, and the physical hand at work. Each mark is a feeling, a chord, each drawing a score witness to a moment in time, a mood, a place. In the silence and introspection engendered, the quietest gesture may very well be the loudest.”
title: Untitled
